title: What is the difference between HD+ Amoled screen and FHD+ Amoled screen? - Quora

response.answer_text: HD+ has 720 pixels across the width and has more than 1360 pixels across the length. That's why it is called HD+ since HD i.e 720p has 720 pixels across width and 1360 across length. FHD+ has 1080 pixels across the width and has more than 1920 pixels across the length. That's why it is called FHD+ since FHD i.e 1080p has 1080 pixels across width and 1920 across length. SIMPLY PUT, FHD+ HAS MORE RESOLUTION THAN HD+.
